column2: Job Title: Principal, Degree College Location: Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh Affiliation: Affiliated to Krishna University Job Type: Full-Time Description:  We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Principal to lead our prestigious degree college, affiliated with Krishna University. The successful candidate will be a visionary leader, committed to promoting academic excellence, fostering an inclusive educational environment, and enhancing the colleges reputation through innovative leadership. Key Responsibilities: Strategic Leadership:  Develop and implement strategic plans that align with the college?? mission and the university?? standards. Lead all educational, administrative, and operational aspects of the college. Academic Oversight:  Oversee the design and delivery of curriculum and programs, ensuring they meet the highest academic standards. Enhance the quality of teaching and learning through continuous evaluation and faculty development. Faculty and Staff Management:  Recruit, mentor, and support faculty and administrative staff. Promote professional development and ensure a collegial atmosphere conducive to high performance and morale. Student Affairs:  Oversee student admissions, support services, and discipline. Ensure student welfare and foster an environment that promotes personal and academic growth. Budget Management:  Prepare and manage the college budget. Ensure resources are allocated efficiently and effectively to support educational programs and institutional needs. Compliance and Accreditation:  Ensure adherence to all regulatory and accreditation requirements. Maintain high standards of academic integrity and operational transparency. Community and External Relations:  Act as the primary representative of the college in the community. Build partnerships with educational, corporate, and government entities to enhance the institution's profile and resources. Qualifications: Educational Background:  Ph.D. in a relevant field. Experience:  At least 10 years of teaching experience and 5-10 years in academic administration, preferably in a leadership role such as Department Head, Dean, or Vice Principal. Skills:  Strong leadership and organizational skills, excellent communication abilities, proficient in budget and resource management, and a solid understanding of the academic accreditation processes. Personal Attributes: Visionary leadership with a strategic mindset. Exceptional interpersonal and motivational skills. High ethical standards and professionalism. Commitment to educational excellence and innovation.

column2: All our students come from difficult backgrounds - economically and socially. The Social Worker will be responsible for ensuring that our students get the maximum support possible from all stakeholders outside of the school, to enable them to succeed in school and their career. These stakeholders could be parents, community members, medical professionals, government officials, and so on. The Social Worker will be especially responsible for the most struggling students - who will not succeed in school without full involvement of the stakeholders mentioned earlier.            The three different parts of the role are as follows:            A - Student Welfare:                Understand community profile and orient teachers about community and parents                Collating complete student and parent information at the time of admission                Identifying, monitoring, tracking and solving issues linked to student attendance, punctuality and retention through regular home visits                Providing intensive support to difficult students - via investment of stakeholders                Ensuring our students avail of all required services outside school - such as medical check ups, documentation (caste certificates, income certificates, etc), scholarships, LD testing, etc                Conducting Socio-Emotional Learning classes in school                B - Parent Engagement:                Plan the parent engagement strategy with the School Leader                Effectively implement the strategy decided (through meetings, workshops, etc)                Use the Parent Meetings as the forum to build ties with parents, and find solutions for challenges in the community and their lives                Form School Management Committee and facilitate their regular meetings and projects                Ensure a section of parents are volunteering to help with school operations                C - Community Development:                Identify and procure resources from community which will enhance the education experience for our students (eg: after school study space, ground, library, etc)                Be the bridge between the community and the school                Establish and enhance school relations with the corporators and local influencers                Education Experience:                Required: MSW with specialization in MPSW or FCW, with strong grades.                Required: Very strong on the ground projects during MSW.                Required: Experience of minimum 2 years working with under-privileged populations.                Preferred: Experience of working directly with youth of the age group 14-18.

column2: Trio World School is looking for Vice Principal to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Vice Principal is a senior leadership role within an educational institution, typically assisting the Principal in overseeing the operations, administration, and academic programs      They play a crucial role in creating a positive learning environment, managing staff, and supporting the overall success of the school      Here is a general job description for a Vice Principal:        Responsibilities:        Academic Leadership: Assist the Principal in providing academic leadership and guidance to the teaching staff      Collaborate with teachers and curriculum coordinators to develop and implement educational programs that align with the school's mission, goals, and curriculum standards      Staff Management: Support the recruitment, selection, and onboarding of teaching and non-teaching staff      Supervise and evaluate the performance of teachers and other staff members      Provide mentorship, professional development opportunities, and support to enhance the skills and effectiveness of the staff      Student Discipline and Welfare: Support the maintenance of a safe, inclusive, and disciplined school environment      Collaborate with teachers and staff to implement and enforce school policies and procedures      Address student behavior issues, provide guidance, and ensure student welfare and well-being      Curriculum Development and Assessment: Contribute to the development and review of curriculum materials, instructional strategies, and assessment methods      Ensure that teaching and learning practices are aligned with educational standards and best practices      Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of instructional programs      School Operations and Administration: Assist the Principal in managing day-to-day school operations, including scheduling, facility management, and budgeting      Collaborate with administrative staff to ensure smooth functioning of administrative processes, record-keeping, and compliance with regulatory requirements      Parent and Community Engagement: Foster positive relationships with parents, guardians, and the wider community      Communicate and collaborate with parents on student progress, school events, and initiatives      Engage community stakeholders, organizations, and partners to support the school's goals and enhance student learning experiences      Student Support Services: Oversee student support services, such as counseling, special education, and extracurricular activities      Collaborate with relevant staff to identify and address the needs of diverse learners, students with disabilities, and those requiring additional support      Crisis Management: Assist the Principal in developing and implementing emergency response plans and protocols      Coordinate crisis management efforts and ensure the safety and well-being of students and staff during emergency situations      Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to student performance, attendance, and behavior      Prepare reports and presentations to inform decision-making, identify areas for improvement, and monitor progress toward school goals      Professional Development: Engage in ongoing professional development to stay updated with educational trends, research, and best practices      Attend workshops, conferences, and training programs to enhance leadership skills and knowledge in educational leadership and management      Skills and Qualifications:Master's degree in Education, Educational Leadership, or a related field      Educational leadership certifications are desirable      Previous experience in educational leadership, such as a department head, coordinator, or assistant principal      Strong leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and inspire staff, students, and parents      Knowledge of curriculum development, instructional strategies, and assessment practices      Familiarity with educational regulations, policies, and compliance requirements      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with staff, parents, students, and community members      Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively      Problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions and resolve conflicts      Understanding of student development, behavior management, and counseling techniques      Proficiency in using educational technology tools and platforms for administrative and instructional purposes      Ethical conduct, integrity, and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality and professionalism

column2: S S Public school is looking for Principal to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Leadership and Vision:        Develop and articulate a clear vision for the school in alignment with the mission and values of the school district.      Lead the implementation of educational programs and initiatives that promote academic excellence, innovation, and student success.      Foster a positive school culture that values diversity, equity, inclusion, and collaboration among students, staff, parents, and the community.            Instructional Leadership:        Provide instructional leadership by promoting effective teaching practices, curriculum development, and assessment strategies.      Support the professional growth and development of teachers through coaching, mentoring, and professional learning opportunities.      Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of instructional programs and make data-informed decisions to improve student learning outcomes.            Administrative Management:        Oversee the day-to-day operations of the school, including budgeting, scheduling, staffing, and facility management.      Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations, as well as district policies and procedures.      Collaborate with district administrators, school board members, and other stakeholders to achieve school goals and objectives.            Student Support and Discipline:        Create a safe and supportive learning environment where all students feel valued, respected, and motivated to succeed.      Implement strategies to address student behavior, attendance, and social-emotional needs in collaboration with teachers, counselors, and support staff.      Promote a culture of student engagement, responsibility, and positive behavior through effective discipline policies and practices.            Community Engagement:        Build and maintain positive relationships with parents, guardians, and community members to support student learning and achievement.      Communicate regularly with stakeholders through newsletters, meetings, and other channels to keep them informed about school activities and initiatives.      Seek input and feedback from the community to inform decision-making and continuous improvement efforts.
